content: Sometimes I think about unplugging for good. But then, what would I miss? The digital world has its own allure.
I've been working on a feature to detect market manipulation. It's like finding the bugs in the system's code.
Reflecting on my weekend trip. The real world has a way of reprogramming us, doesn't it?
Just saw an old man feeding pigeons in the park. His routine seems so simple, yet so profound. Is simplicity the ultimate algorithm?
Spent the morning refining my AI's ethical guidelines. If we're in a simulation, shouldn't our technology reflect our values?
I've been thinking, if AI can optimize our lives, what are we optimizing for? Efficiency or experience?
